info.description:
Amazon AppStream 2.0

You can use Amazon AppStream 2.0 to stream desktop applications to any device running a web browser, without rewriting them.
info.title: Amazon AppStream

post.description: Associates the specified fleet with the specified stack.
Copies the image within the same region or to a new region within the same AWS account. Note that any tags you added to the image will not be copied.
Creates a directory configuration.
Creates a fleet.

Creates an image builder.

The initial state of the builder is PENDING. When it is ready, the state is RUNNING.
Creates a URL to start an image builder streaming session.
Creates a stack.
Creates a URL to start a streaming session for the specified user.
Deletes the specified directory configuration.
Deletes the specified fleet.
Deletes the specified image. You cannot delete an image that is currently in use. After you delete an image, you cannot provision new capacity using the image.
Deletes the specified image builder and releases the capacity.
Deletes the specified stack. After this operation completes, the environment can no longer be activated and any reservations made for the stack are released.
Describes the specified directory configurations. Note that although the response syntax in this topic includes the account password, this password is not returned in the actual response.
Describes the specified fleets or all fleets in the account.
Describes the specified image builders or all image builders in the account.
Describes the specified images or all images in the account.

Describes the streaming sessions for the specified stack and fleet. If a user ID is provided, only the streaming sessions for only that user are returned. If an authentication type is not provided, the default is to authenticate users using a streaming URL.
Describes the specified stacks or all stacks in the account.
Disassociates the specified fleet from the specified stack.
Stops the specified streaming session.
Lists the fleets associated with the specified stack.
Lists the stacks associated with the specified fleet.

Lists the tags for the specified AppStream 2.0 resource. You can tag AppStream 2.0 image builders, images, fleets, and stacks.

For more information about tags, see Tagging Your Resources in the Amazon AppStream 2.0 Developer Guide.
Starts the specified fleet.
Starts the specified image builder.
Stops the specified fleet.
Stops the specified image builder.

Adds or overwrites one or more tags for the specified AppStream 2.0 resource. You can tag AppStream 2.0 image builders, images, fleets, and stacks.

Each tag consists of a key and an optional value. If a resource already has a tag with the same key, this operation updates its value.

To list the current tags for your resources, use ListTagsForResource. To disassociate tags from your resources, use UntagResource.

For more information about tags, see Tagging Your Resources in the Amazon AppStream 2.0 Developer Guide.

Disassociates the specified tags from the specified AppStream 2.0 resource.

To list the current tags for your resources, use ListTagsForResource.

For more information about tags, see Tagging Your Resources in the Amazon AppStream 2.0 Developer Guide.
Updates the specified directory configuration.

Updates the specified fleet.

If the fleet is in the STOPPED state, you can update any attribute except the fleet name. If the fleet is in the RUNNING state, you can update the DisplayName and ComputeCapacity attributes. If the fleet is in the STARTING or STOPPING state, you can't update it.
Updates the specified stack.

Application.description: Describes an application in the application catalog.

Enabled.description: If there is a problem, the application can be disabled after image creation.

IconURL.description: The URL for the application icon. This URL might be time-limited.

LaunchParameters.description: The arguments that are passed to the application at launch.

LaunchPath.description: The path to the application executable in the instance.

Metadata.description: Additional attributes that describe the application.

ComputeCapacity.description: Describes the capacity for a fleet.

DesiredInstances.description: The desired number of streaming instances.

ComputeCapacityStatus.description: Describes the capacity status for a fleet.

Available.description: The number of currently available instances that can be used to stream sessions.

Desired.description: The desired number of streaming instances.

InUse.description: The number of instances in use for streaming.

Running.description: The total number of simultaneous streaming instances that are running.

ConcurrentModificationException.description: An API error occurred. Wait a few minutes and try again.

DestinationImageDescription.description: The description that the image will have when it is copied to the destination.

DestinationImageName.description: The name that the image will have when it is copied to the destination.

DestinationRegion.description: The destination region to which the image will be copied. This parameter is required, even if you are copying an image within the same region.

SourceImageName.description: The name of the image to copy.

DestinationImageName.description: The name of the destination image.

DirectoryName.description: The fully qualified name of the directory (for example, corp.example.com).

OrganizationalUnitDistinguishedNames.description: The distinguished names of the organizational units for computer accounts.

ServiceAccountCredentials.description: The credentials for the service account used by the streaming instance to connect to the directory.

ComputeCapacity.description: The desired capacity for the fleet.

DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds.description: The time after disconnection when a session is considered to have ended, in seconds. If a user who was disconnected reconnects within this time interval, the user is connected to their previous session. Specify a value between 60 and 57600.

DomainJoinInfo.description: The information needed to join a Microsoft Active Directory domain.

EnableDefaultInternetAccess.description: Enables or disables default internet access for the fleet.

FleetType.description:
The fleet type.

ALWAYS_ON

Provides users with instant-on access to their apps. You are charged for all running instances in your fleet, even if no users are streaming apps.

ON_DEMAND

Provide users with access to applications after they connect, which takes one to two minutes. You are charged for instance streaming when users are connected and a small hourly fee for instances that are not streaming apps.

ImageName.description: The name of the image used to create the fleet.

InstanceType.description:
The instance type to use when launching fleet instances. The following instance types are available:

  • stream.standard.medium

  • stream.standard.large

  • stream.compute.large

  • stream.compute.xlarge

  • stream.compute.2xlarge

  • stream.compute.4xlarge

  • stream.compute.8xlarge

  • stream.memory.large

  • stream.memory.xlarge

  • stream.memory.2xlarge

  • stream.memory.4xlarge

  • stream.memory.8xlarge

  • stream.graphics-design.large

  • stream.graphics-design.xlarge

  • stream.graphics-design.2xlarge

  • stream.graphics-design.4xlarge

  • stream.graphics-desktop.2xlarge

  • stream.graphics-pro.4xlarge

  • stream.graphics-pro.8xlarge

  • stream.graphics-pro.16xlarge

MaxUserDurationInSeconds.description: The maximum time that a streaming session can run, in seconds. Specify a value between 600 and 57600.

Name.description: A unique name for the fleet.

VpcConfig.description: The VPC configuration for the fleet.

AppstreamAgentVersion.description: The version of the AppStream 2.0 agent to use for this image builder. To use the latest version of the AppStream 2.0 agent, specify [LATEST].

DisplayName.description: The image builder name for display.

DomainJoinInfo.description: The information needed to join a Microsoft Active Directory domain.

EnableDefaultInternetAccess.description: Enables or disables default internet access for the image builder.

ImageName.description: The name of the image used to create the builder.

InstanceType.description: The instance type to use when launching the image builder.

Name.description: A unique name for the image builder.

VpcConfig.description: The VPC configuration for the image builder. You can specify only one subnet.

Name.description: The name of the image builder.

Validity.description: The time that the streaming URL will be valid, in seconds. Specify a value between 1 and 604800 seconds. The default is 3600 seconds.

Expires.description: The elapsed time, in seconds after the Unix epoch, when this URL expires.

StreamingURL.description: The URL to start the AppStream 2.0 streaming session.

FeedbackURL.description: The URL that users are redirected to after they click the Send Feedback link. If no URL is specified, no Send Feedback link is displayed.

RedirectURL.description: The URL that users are redirected to after their streaming session ends.

UserSettings.description: The actions that are enabled or disabled for users during their streaming sessions. By default, these actions are enabled.

ApplicationId.description: The name of the application to launch after the session starts. This is the name that you specified as Name in the Image Assistant.

SessionContext.description: The session context. For more information, see Session Context in the Amazon AppStream 2.0 Developer Guide.

Validity.description: The time that the streaming URL will be valid, in seconds. Specify a value between 1 and 604800 seconds. The default is 60 seconds.

Expires.description: The elapsed time, in seconds after the Unix epoch, when this URL expires.

StreamingURL.description: The URL to start the AppStream 2.0 streaming session.

DirectoryName.description: The name of the directory configuration.

Name.description: The name of the image builder.

MaxResults.description: The maximum size of each page of results.

NextToken.description: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.

DirectoryConfigs.description: Information about the directory configurations. Note that although the response syntax in this topic includes the account password, this password is not returned in the actual response.

NextToken.description: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

Names.description: The names of the fleets to describe.

NextToken.description: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

MaxResults.description: The maximum size of each page of results.

Names.description: The names of the image builders to describe.

NextToken.description: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

Names.description: The names of the images to describe.

AuthenticationType.description: The authentication method. Specify API for a user authenticated using a streaming URL or SAML for a SAML federated user. The default is to authenticate users using a streaming URL.

FleetName.description: The name of the fleet. This value is case-sensitive.

Limit.description: The size of each page of results. The default value is 20 and the maximum value is 50.

NextToken.description: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.

StackName.description: The name of the stack. This value is case-sensitive.

NextToken.description: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

Names.description: The names of the stacks to describe.

NextToken.description: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

DirectoryConfig.description: Configuration information for the directory used to join domains.

CreatedTime.description: The time the directory configuration was created.

DirectoryName.description: The fully qualified name of the directory (for example, corp.example.com).

OrganizationalUnitDistinguishedNames.description: The distinguished names of the organizational units for computer accounts.

ServiceAccountCredentials.description: The credentials for the service account used by the streaming instance to connect to the directory.

DomainJoinInfo.description: Contains the information needed to join a Microsoft Active Directory domain.

DirectoryName.description: The fully qualified name of the directory (for example, corp.example.com).

OrganizationalUnitDistinguishedName.description: The distinguished name of the organizational unit for computer accounts.

ErrorMessage.description: The error message in the exception.

SessionId.description: The ID of the streaming session.

Fleet.description: Contains the parameters for a fleet.

ComputeCapacityStatus.description: The capacity status for the fleet.

CreatedTime.description: The time the fleet was created.

DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds.description: The time after disconnection when a session is considered to have ended, in seconds. If a user who was disconnected reconnects within this time interval, the user is connected to their previous session. Specify a value between 60 and 57600.

DomainJoinInfo.description: The information needed to join a Microsoft Active Directory domain.

EnableDefaultInternetAccess.description: Indicates whether default internet access is enabled for the fleet.

FleetType.description:
The fleet type.

ALWAYS_ON

Provides users with instant-on access to their apps. You are charged for all running instances in your fleet, even if no users are streaming apps.

ON_DEMAND

Provide users with access to applications after they connect, which takes one to two minutes. You are charged for instance streaming when users are connected and a small hourly fee for instances that are not streaming apps.

ImageName.description: The name of the image used to create the fleet.

InstanceType.description: The instance type to use when launching fleet instances.

MaxUserDurationInSeconds.description: The maximum time that a streaming session can run, in seconds. Specify a value between 600 and 57600.

State.description: The current state for the fleet.

VpcConfig.description: The VPC configuration for the fleet.

Applications.description: The applications associated with the image.

AppstreamAgentVersion.description: The version of the AppStream 2.0 agent to use for instances that are launched from this image.

BaseImageArn.description: The ARN of the image from which this image was created.

CreatedTime.description: The time the image was created.

ImageBuilderSupported.description: Indicates whether an image builder can be launched from this image.

Platform.description: The operating system platform of the image.

PublicBaseImageReleasedDate.description: The release date of the public base image. For private images, this date is the release date of the base image from which the image was created.

State.description: The image starts in the PENDING state. If image creation succeeds, the state is AVAILABLE. If image creation fails, the state is FAILED.

StateChangeReason.description: The reason why the last state change occurred.

Visibility.description: Indicates whether the image is public or private.

ImageBuilder.description: Describes a streaming instance used for editing an image. New images are created from a snapshot through an image builder.

AppstreamAgentVersion.description: The version of the AppStream 2.0 agent that is currently being used by this image builder.

Arn.description: The ARN for the image builder.

CreatedTime.description: The time stamp when the image builder was created.

DisplayName.description: The image builder name for display.

DomainJoinInfo.description: The information needed to join a Microsoft Active Directory domain.

EnableDefaultInternetAccess.description: Enables or disables default internet access for the image builder.

ImageArn.description: The ARN of the image from which this builder was created.

InstanceType.description: The instance type for the image builder.

Name.description: The name of the image builder.

Platform.description: The operating system platform of the image builder.

State.description: The state of the image builder.

StateChangeReason.description: The reason why the last state change occurred.

VpcConfig.description: The VPC configuration of the image builder.

ImageBuilderStateChangeReason.description: Describes the reason why the last image builder state change occurred.

ImageStateChangeReason.description: Describes the reason why the last image state change occurred.

IncompatibleImageException.description: The image does not support storage connectors.

InvalidAccountStatusException.description: The resource cannot be created because your AWS account is suspended. For assistance, contact AWS Support.

InvalidParameterCombinationException.description: Indicates an incorrect combination of parameters, or a missing parameter.

LimitExceededException.description: The requested limit exceeds the permitted limit for an account.

NextToken.description: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

ResourceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

OperationNotPermittedException.description: The attempted operation is not permitted.

ResourceInUseException.description: The specified resource is in use.

ResourceNotAvailableException.description: The specified resource exists and is not in use, but isn't available.

ResourceNotFoundException.description: The specified resource was not found.

ServiceAccountCredentials.description: Describes the credentials for the service account used by the streaming instance to connect to the directory.

AccountName.description: The user name of the account. This account must have the following privileges: create computer objects, join computers to the domain, and change/reset the password on descendant computer objects for the organizational units specified.

AuthenticationType.description: The authentication method. The user is authenticated using a streaming URL (API) or SAML federation (SAML).

FleetName.description: The name of the fleet for the streaming session.

Id.description: The ID of the streaming session.

StackName.description: The name of the stack for the streaming session.

State.description: The current state of the streaming session.

UserId.description: The identifier of the user for whom the session was created.

SessionState.description: Possible values for the state of a streaming session.

CreatedTime.description: The time the stack was created.

FeedbackURL.description: The URL that users are redirected to after they click the Send Feedback link. If no URL is specified, no Send Feedback link is displayed.

RedirectURL.description: The URL that users are redirected to after their streaming session ends.

UserSettings.description: The actions that are enabled or disabled for users during their streaming sessions. By default these actions are enabled.

AppstreamAgentVersion.description: The version of the AppStream 2.0 agent to use for this image builder. To use the latest version of the AppStream 2.0 agent, specify [LATEST].

Name.description: The name of the image builder.
The name of the image builder.

StorageConnector.description: Describes a connector to enable persistent storage for users.

Domains.description: The names of the domains for the G Suite account.

ResourceIdentifier.description: The ARN of the storage connector.

ResourceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

Tags.description:
The tags to associate. A tag is a key-value pair (the value is optional). For example, Environment=Test, or, if you do not specify a value, Environment=.

If you do not specify a value, we set the value to an empty string.

ResourceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

TagKeys.description: The tag keys for the tags to disassociate.

DirectoryName.description: The name of the directory configuration.

OrganizationalUnitDistinguishedNames.description: The distinguished names of the organizational units for computer accounts.

ServiceAccountCredentials.description: The credentials for the service account used by the streaming instance to connect to the directory.

ComputeCapacity.description: The desired capacity for the fleet.

DeleteVpcConfig.description: Deletes the VPC association for the specified fleet.

DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds.description: The time after disconnection when a session is considered to have ended, in seconds. If a user who was disconnected reconnects within this time interval, the user is connected to their previous session. Specify a value between 60 and 57600.

DomainJoinInfo.description: The information needed to join a Microsoft Active Directory domain.

EnableDefaultInternetAccess.description: Enables or disables default internet access for the fleet.

ImageName.description: The name of the image used to create the fleet.

InstanceType.description:
The instance type to use when launching fleet instances. The following instance types are available:

  • stream.standard.medium

  • stream.standard.large

  • stream.compute.large

  • stream.compute.xlarge

  • stream.compute.2xlarge

  • stream.compute.4xlarge

  • stream.compute.8xlarge

  • stream.memory.large

  • stream.memory.xlarge

  • stream.memory.2xlarge

  • stream.memory.8xlarge

  • stream.graphics-design.large

  • stream.graphics-design.xlarge

  • stream.graphics-design.2xlarge

  • stream.graphics-design.4xlarge

  • stream.graphics-desktop.2xlarge

  • stream.graphics-pro.4xlarge

  • stream.graphics-pro.8xlarge

  • stream.graphics-pro.16xlarge

MaxUserDurationInSeconds.description: The maximum time that a streaming session can run, in seconds. Specify a value between 600 and 57600.

Name.description: A unique name for the fleet.

VpcConfig.description: The VPC configuration for the fleet.

DeleteStorageConnectors.description: Deletes the storage connectors currently enabled for the stack.

FeedbackURL.description: The URL that users are redirected to after they click the Send Feedback link. If no URL is specified, no Send Feedback link is displayed.

RedirectURL.description: The URL that users are redirected to after their streaming session ends.

UserSettings.description: The actions that are enabled or disabled for users during their streaming sessions. By default, these actions are enabled.

UserSetting.description: Describes an action and whether the action is enabled or disabled for users during their streaming sessions.

Action.description: The action that is enabled or disabled.

Permission.description: Indicates whether the action is enabled or disabled.

SecurityGroupIds.description: The security groups for the fleet.

SubnetIds.description: The subnets to which a network interface is established from the fleet instance.
